intro: Stellaria crassipes, commonly known as broad-leaved starwort, is a low-growing perennial herb native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems and opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its flowers have five petals and are arranged in a star-like pattern, giving the species its common name. Stellaria crassipes is often found in moist, disturbed soils such as roadsides, meadows, and wetlands.
